info.title: Supabase API (v1)
info.description:
Supabase API generated from the OpenAPI specification.
Visit [https://supabase.com/docs](https://supabase.com/docs) for a complete documentation.

get.description: Fetches configurations of the specified database branch

500.description: Failed to retrieve database branch

patch.description: Updates the configuration of the specified database branch

reset_on_push.description: This field is deprecated and will be ignored. Use v1-reset-a-branch endpoint directly instead.

notify_url.description: HTTP endpoint to receive branch status updates.

latest_check_run_id.description: This field is deprecated and will not be populated.

500.description: Failed to update database branch

delete.description: Deletes the specified database branch. By default, deletes immediately. Use force=false to schedule deletion with 1-hour grace period (only when soft deletion is enabled).

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If set to false, schedule deletion with 1-hour grace period (only when soft deletion is enabled).

500.description: Failed to delete database branch
Failed to push database branch
Failed to merge database branch
Failed to reset database branch

post.description: Cancels scheduled deletion and restores the branch to active state

500.description: Failed to restore database branch

get.description: Diffs the specified database branch

500.description: Failed to diff database branch

get.description:
Returns a list of all projects you've previously created.

Use `/v1/organizations/{slug}/projects` instead when possible to get more precise results and pagination support.

plan.description: Subscription Plan is now set on organization level and is ignored in this request

region.description: Region you want your server to reside in. Use region_selection instead.

code.description: Specific region code. The codes supported are not a stable API, and should be retrieved from the /available-regions endpoint.
The Smart Region Group's code. The codes supported are not a stable API, and should be retrieved from the /available-regions endpoint.

region_selection.description: Region selection. Only one of region or region_selection can be specified.

kps_enabled.description: This field is deprecated and is ignored in this request

template_url.description: Template URL used to create the project from the CLI.

release_channel.description: Release channel. If not provided, GA will be used.

postgres_engine.description: Postgres engine version. If not provided, the latest version will be used.

parameters.name: continent
parameters.description: Continent code to determine regional recommendations: NA (North America), SA (South America), EU (Europe), AF (Africa), AS (Asia), OC (Oceania), AN (Antarctica)

get.summary: [Beta] Gets the list of available regions that can be used for a new project

get.description: Returns a list of organizations that you currently belong to.

500.description: Unexpected error listing organizations
Unexpected error creating an organization

500.description: Failed to apply project addon

delete.description: Disables the selected addon variant, including rolling the compute instance back to its previous size.

500.description: Failed to remove project addon

delete.summary: Remove billing addons or revert compute instance sizing

get.description: This is an **experimental** endpoint. It is subject to change or removal in future versions. Use it with caution, as it may not remain supported or stable.
This is an **experimental** endpoint. It is subject to change or removal in future versions. Use it with caution, as it may not remain supported or stable.

Executes a SQL query on the project's logs.

Either the `iso_timestamp_start` and `iso_timestamp_end` parameters must be provided.
If both are not provided, only the last 1 minute of logs will be queried.
The timestamp range must be no more than 24 hours and is rounded to the nearest minute. If the range is more than 24 hours, a validation error will be thrown.

Note: Unless the `sql` parameter is provided, only edge_logs will be queried. See the [log query docs](/docs/guides/telemetry/logs?queryGroups=product&product=postgres&queryGroups=source&source=edge_logs#querying-with-the-logs-explorer:~:text=logs%20from%20the-,Sources,-drop%2Ddown%3A) for all available sources.

parameters.name: sql
parameters.description: Custom SQL query to execute on the logs. See [querying logs](/docs/guides/telemetry/logs?queryGroups=product&product=postgres&queryGroups=source&source=edge_logs#querying-with-the-logs-explorer) for more details.

get.summary: Gets project details for the specified organization and claim token

get.description:
Returns a paginated list of projects for the specified organization.

This endpoint uses offset-based pagination. Use the `offset` parameter to skip a number of projects and the `limit` parameter to control the number of projects returned per page.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of projects to return per page

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of project statuses to filter by.

The following values are supported: `ACTIVE_HEALTHY`, `INACTIVE`.

count.description: Total number of projects. Use this to calculate the total number of pages.

limit.description: Maximum number of projects per page

offset.description: Number of projects skipped in this response

500.description: Failed to retrieve projects
